title: Poster, 1972
medium: Offset lithograph on white wove paper
provenance: From the collection of Dan Friedman.
description: Poster employing 169 "symbol signs" or pictographs in black, and sometimes gray, in white squares from top to bottom of sheet.  Symbols represent an international visual "language" that instructs the viewer to the many activities and regulations of the Olympic Village in Münich durning the 1972 Games. These are presented on a uniform silver-gray background with instructive text in black on the left side of the sheet [in German].  To the right of each of the 24 rows of signs, there is printed text [in German] detailing the image.

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, 1972.
1972. Offset lithograph on white wove paper. Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-167.
